headline: Brown Sugar Meatloaf
description: This brown sugar meatloaf is glazed with brown sugar and ketchup for a moist and flavorful weeknight dinner that is as easy as it is delicious.

video.description: See how to make a 5-star meatloaf that‚Äôs tangy and slightly sweet.
video.name: Brown Sugar Meatloaf

name: Brown Sugar Meatloaf
recipeIngredient: 0.75 cup finely crushed saltine cracker crumbs

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 5x9-inch loaf pan.
Press brown sugar into the bottom of the prepared loaf pan and spread ketchup over top sugar.
Mix all remaining ingredients thoroughly in a mixing bowl and shape into a loaf. Place on top of the ketchup and sugar crust.
Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour or until juices are clear.

review.reviewBody: Made this, and the family loved it. It's really the first time I've had a meatloaf hold together, look good and taste great.

I tried making this the first time for 5 kids with the topping on top like other reviews suggested and they loved it. I tried making it again just as the recipe wrote with the brown sugar and ketchup on bottom and I loved it even more. This recipe is amazing.
Love the meatloaf. Mixed the brown sugar and ketchup and added to the bottom of pan. Also added 1tbsp. Worchestire sauce. Taste delish!
Me and my daughter just love this recipe! I make it often üòÅ

We loved this. I only had 1 pound of ground beef so I chopped up some fresh mushrooms and added those for additional volume. I did add some worcestershire to the meat mixture and would probably cut the brown sugar a bit as it is pretty sweet but overall great taste and easy.

I made this meatloaf almost as written except for doubling the amounts to make 2 loaves and I also used club crackers instead of saltines. My husband never liked meatloaf but now this is one of his favorite meals..

My family LOVES this recipe. The only change I made is that I add a Lipton onion packet. One of my kiddos says he doesn't like onion :) so instead of using a chopped onion, I use the stuff that he can't see. And he loves it! Go figure. I give this recipe 5 stars!
My family really likes this recipe. My husband won‚Äôt eat any of the other recipes for meatloaf
Easy and excellent!

We have been using this recipe for years... Never fails to delight the taste buds. Only variation:. Hold back brown sugar/ketchup, press meat mix into loaf pan, drop formed loaf on metal tray, back for 10min. , Then coat w/ brown sugar/ketchup mix. Continue baking 40-45 minutes.

Recipe was great, I did like other reviewers suggested and put the ketchup brown sugar mix on top instead of the bottom. I also added a green pepper so i could use it up and 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce. Used bread on the bottom to soak up a lot of the grease. Will make this again!

I have looked for the perfect meatloaf recipe for 20 years and now I have found it. All my other recipes resulted in meatloaf that fell to pieces. I love that this one is nice and firm and doesn't fall apart. I put the glaze on top like others suggest. My whole family loves this meatloaf.

I‚Äôm not a huge meatloaf fan but overall the reviews from the family were mixed. I‚Äôd really give this recipe as is a 3.5. The initial sweetness of the bottom portion of the meatloaf was unexpected because meatloaf tends to be savory. I personally expected the sweetness because I made it, but the biggest complainer also added additional ketchup, which I feel adds additional sweetness, to cover up the taste. I think I would make this again without the brown sugar and ketchup. The more savory top of the meatloaf was really pretty good.

I loved this although I did modify due limited items and only 1 1b ground beef vs 1 1/2 lb ground beef. I used 1/3 cup brown sugar but instead of ketchup used El Pato hot tomato sauce, 2/3 cup milk and 2/3 cup of French fries onion since I didn‚Äôt have crackers. Everything else was same. This was the best meatloaf I have ever made - the juices served as a gravy over the mash potatoes and the hot sauce with the sugar was NOT overly sweet. And easy, easy, easy. Made right after work, walked the dogs while it baked for an hour and enjoyed a great meal with the family. Thank you for sharing!

I'm a guy so I don't follow instructions well. I mixed everything together and didn't pack the brown sugar a cover it with the ketchup in the bottom of the pan. But it still turned out fantastic. I will continue to make it this way.
ok
Pretty damn good. No changes. Thank you.

So i too changed up this recipe a little bit.. I used part ground beef and part ground sausage. Instead of using an onion, i used a packet of onion soup mix and put the ketchup and brown sugar mixture on top of the loaf the last 15 min of baking. I know it was good since my husband ate almost the whole loaf in one sitting. We will def make this again.
This meatloaf was easy and wonderful tasting, I will make this again !
I didn't use milk. But it was delicious.
I truly disliked it and I love brown sugar. Definitely won't make again
I really didn't think much of it when I was making it, but I admit I really like it and it was my first time making meatloaf so I enjoyed it very much

Loved this but made changes many suggested. Used 1/2 c milk and 1/4 c brown sugar, 1 egg, substituted Italian style bread crumbs for saltines and added 2 cloves minced garlic. I mixed the sugar and ketchup adding 1T Worcester sauce making a glaze and spreading this on the bottom of the pan and to the top of the loaf. Everyone enjoyed this.
Quick n easy! Very delicious!

This was delicious! Like other reviewers, I put the glaze on top, especially since I used my loaf pan with the bottom piece that has drainage holes for the fat. I like to try different meat loaf recipes and am often disappointed, but not with this version -- it's easy to assemble and has no 'exotic' ingredients, yet is very tasty. I will definitely make this one again. Thanks for sharing!
really good but I mixed the brown sugar in the meat and put ketchup on about 10 minutes until done
Good recipe
My husband loves this meatloaf recipe! It‚Äôs very tasty, the only recipe I make now.
A very good meatloaf without too much filler. Mild good flavor with the sweetness of brown sugar and catsup topping (when upside downed)!! I make no changes and love the recipe just the way it is!!
Made it, but put some brown sugar and ketchup on top , as well as bottom, also put three slices of bacon on top.

I haven't had meatloaf in 25 years and thought...My mother made it, I should too!" Man oh man! This reminded me of my mother's meatloaf. My fiancee doesn't really care for ground beef but I couldn't stop getting her more. That was amazing. And then I had some 4" cake pans and made them each mini loafs and added the glaze when it was all fully cooked. Turned the broiler on High and lightly burned the topping and we'll, um, I ate 4 of the 6. Great and easy recipe. especially when you have a kitchen aid dough hook doing all the work.
I use this recipe as my base. I don't use ginger (never remember to buy any) and use onion powder (don't like onion texture) . Then I double it. Very yummy.
The best recipe for meatloaf ever! My husband loves venison, I do not. So I always use this recipe and we both love it.
Love this recipe! It is my go-to for meatloaf. Entire family LOVES IT!

I wrote a review about this already, but I wanted to add pictures. I make mini loaves with a pointer finger sized well for the sauce on TOP. I made last nights with Miltons GF Sea Salt Crip Crackers, and honestly I think it like them better. My niece is GF that‚Äôs why I had them. This is the most comforting yummy food. Thank you for the recipe! I‚Äôve made it at least 20 times!
I am not a meatloaf fan but I do like this recipe. It is easy to make and my husband loves it.

I have made this meatloaf three times so far. It is absolutely delicious!!! I use a store-bought meatloaf meat mix, and add 1/4 tsp. of basil and 1/4 tsp. of smoked paprika. Since I am allergic to dairy I used plain, unsweetened almond milk instead of regular milk. I'm not sure if it is because I live in low elevations, but I find that it needs to cook for 1 hour, 20 minutes instead of 1 hour. This meatloaf makes its own topping sauce, which is really tasty! Once done Just be sure to remove the meatloaf to a platter, mix up the sauce in the pan and then use a spoon to scoop the grease off the top of the sauce.

I bought a 5x10 loaf pan with removable insert....makes removing the loaf from excess grease easy. plus I add brown sugar then ketchup to top instead of bottom. Also used flavored bread crumbs rather than crackers. you could also use Lipton soup mix beef and onion too.

Always a hit in my household! I took some of the suggestions in the comments and added Worcestershire sauce to the ketchup brown sugar mix. It also went on top of the meatloaf instead of the bottom. Used one egg instead of two and half the milk. Also added some celery. Perfect!

This recipe is amazing. I actually put brown sugar and ketchup on the bottom of the meatloaf in the pan and I also add it to the top of the meatloaf as well. If you want it more well done cook it another 10 to 15 minutes. Love it! It's even great as leftovers cold!

My son's love this meatloaf , as per other reviewers I add some of the amazing sauce in the meat mixture and put the rest on top instead of the bottom.

Thank you for a great meatloaf recipe
This is my family‚Äôs favorite meatloaf: I never liked meatloaf until this recipe. Thanks
It has, despite being a meat loaf, a family favorite. The kids ask for it if they're coming over and always want a portion to take home
I love meatloaf and love to try new recipes. I did not care much for this one. Lacked flavor and texture was a little mushy.
Loved the melted ketchup and sugar all through the meatloaf, different meatloaf and very good. I used flax milk and rice sesame crackers as I can't have milk and eat gluten free.

This is the only meatloaf recipe I use. I use Grass Fed/Grass Finished Beef. (No grease) I put the glaze on the top. I use 1 egg, and Italian or Plain bread crumbs instead of the crackers. My husband is a Meatloaf fanatic. This recipe is his favorite in the 40 years that I have been making meatloaf for him. This recipe slices well, reheats nicely (if you have leftovers) and makes a mean meatloaf sandwich. Just ask my husband! He requests it regularly, even on his birthday!! Thanks for sharing tangastar.

Love, love, love this meatloaf. And for those of you doing Keto - use Golden Monk Fruit sweetener along with sugar free ketchup. You will not notice the difference in flavor. I fed it to my husband and he never noticed the difference! Enjoy!
Great
really good!
It was the tastiest meatloaf I have ever made.
Everytime I make this. Someone leaves with the recipe and the way I make it. I owe it all to you. ‚ù§Ô∏è. It‚Äôs so bomb. One of my best dishes now thank you
Its like eating hamburgers! My kids love it.
It was delicious! So easy to make!
Very easy and delicious
Combined brown sugar and ketchup and put on top for the last 30 minutes. (Did not put on the bottom of pan.)
Nice simple dish that we enjoyed very much!

Great recipe! I added mustard to the top and extra brown sugar, and it was quite tasty. Subbed minced garlic for onion in the 2nd loaf, which is a great alternative; likewise, if no ginger, add curry or Cardamom! Also, both times I made this recipe, I needed to cook the meatloaf an extra 20 minutes!

My go to for meatloaf. Everyone loves it. Read reviews and did the following: used 1/4 c milk and brown sugar. Used a few splashes or Worcestershire sauce in the ketchup and brown sugar mix. Used onion soup mix instead of the onion. Crushed Keebler Club crackers instead of saltines. Put sauce and a couple pieces of bacon on top. Great recipe!!

I made the same changes as suggested in other reviews; decreasing the sugar & milk and adding Worcester shere sause. It was very moist. I also added diced celery, onion, and red pepper. I will definatly make this again!
It was fantastic. I wish I made more. I was very well liked at the dinner table. Lol
This is a family favorite!! Found this recipe over 7 years ago and use it monthly!!! LOVE IT!
9000 people can't be wrong! LOVE this meatloaf. I finely diced a slice of bread in place of the crackers I didn't have.

Loved this recipe. I did change just a few things. I added 1 tbsp chili powder and 1 tbsp of ketchup to all the ingredients. I didn't have saltine crackers so I used Italian breadcrumbs instead. It was very flavorful and moist. Will definitely make it again.

This was the first meatloaf I've made myself. It turned out wonderful! I was worried it would be dry...like the many meatloafs I ate as a child...this recipe turned out delicious!! I did add Worcestershire sauce and a whole cup of ketchup to the mix and added it to the top of the loaf. My ground meat mixture consisted of half beef half elk. I also baked the loaf in a 9x12 glass baking dish rather than a loaf pan. Everyone loved it and wants me to make it again.
Absolutely perfect!!! Thank you!!
This meatloaf is my favorite meatloaf recipe.

The idea is good, but with all the fat from the beef sinking to the bottom, I decided to put the ketchup and brown sugar on top. Otherwise, it sounds like a health disaster in the making. The meatloaf itself was not bad, but not so great. (I made it with 2 1/2 pounds of meat and adjusted the quantities of everything else.)

So I don't remember if I had already reviewed this recipe or not. But it is amazing and it's the only meatloaf recipe that I use. I have no issues with the glaze coming out of the pan on top of the meatloaf whatsoever. It has become one of our families number one meals.

This is one of our favorite family recipes! Everyone in our home eats it and there are never any leftovers. Made it just like the recipes calls for (sometimes I have to substitute bread crumbs with crackers if I don‚Äôt have any breadcrumbs at home). Often pair with a vegetable.
I love this recipe! I did put the ketchup and brown sugar on top so that it would carmelize a little bit.

I think this is the first recipe I ever made from Allrecipes and I have been making it now for 15-20 years. It drives me a little crazy reading the reviews that people complain that the brown sugar and ketchup is on the bottom or they say they put it on the top. I wish there was a way for them to update the recipe to let people know AFTER COOKING, YOU ARE SUPPOSED TO FLIP THE MEATLOAF OVER AND GET IT OUT OF THE PAN SO THE BROWN SUGAR IS ON THE TOP. 

sorry for the all caps. This is one of my favorite recipes and people love it.
Too sweet for me

First off, I have been making meatloaf for over 50 years, and this is the best one yet!!! I essentially followed the recipe, but I did make some minor changes. After reading other reviews, I added 1/2 cup green pepper and celery (because I like them), formed the meatloaf into a loaf, and baked it in an oven-safe skillet on top of a sliced onion. That kept the meatloaf away from the grease, while making it possible to drain off some oil to make gravy for mashed potatoes. Believe it or not, the onions were terrific! This is my new meatloaf recipe! Thank you very much for sharing it.

I have made this meatloaf for 40 yrs but it seems crazy to put the ketchup/brown sugar glaze in the bottom of the pan. I drain the grease at least 2 times during baking. Just make the meatloaf, (I use crumbled bread instead of crackers & I also add chopped bell pepper) bake it & drain a couple times, 1/2 way thru Poke some holes in the loaf with the handle of wooden spoon & pour 1/2 the sauce over top. (1/2 C brown sugar/1/2 c ketchup & 1 tsp mustard) finish baking & drain any remaining grease. Then put the rest of the glaze on top & turn oven on low broil for a couple minutes. This makes the glaze gooie & sticky. Delish
Easy and delicious. Next time I would cut the amount of brown sugar in half though, as I found the sauce to be a bit too sweet. Thanks for the recipe!

I‚Äôll be honest. I do not like meatloaf. I make a GOOD meatloaf (I‚Äôm a good cook), but I DON‚ÄôT LIKE MEATLOAF. Until this recipe. Oh my. This is the only one I‚Äôll fix AND eat. 

TIP: I use a loaf pan that has an insert for grease to drain while it‚Äôs baking. I put the brown sugar and catsup on TOP so it doesn‚Äôt melt into the grease. 

I even eat the leftovers, and I am not a fan of leftovers.
Best meatloaf I have ever made!

I add Worstershire Sauce to the mixture. I used Italian bread crumb seasoning instead of crackers. I put the brown sugar on top meatloaf, then the ketchup on top of that. I did not include the ginger. I used salt, pepper, garlic powder, Worstershire sauce, Italian bread crumbs, 1 egg, milk. Spray tinfoil with cooking spray. Cook uncovered.

This recipe is good but i had to alter it. I actually mixed the brown sugar into the beef and instead of ketchup i used bbq sauce mixed into the beef as well as coating the meatloaf with the bbq sauce for 15 minutes at the end of baking it. These changes made a huge difference for the better on the brown sugar flavor on the meatloaf giving that flavor in every bite.
Excellent, thought it might be too sweet but it is delicious
Delicious, my kids loved it!! Always feels great when my kids compliment my cooking
Very tasty.
Best meatloaf I have ever eaten. Family begs me to make it.
Good, though a little strong on the mustard. I added a little more ketchup but the mustard was still a bit overwhelming, I would reduce to 1 T.
Update on my previous post: It's awesome! I did tweak it a bit and will make again very soon.
My family tore this meatloaf up!! I put a few more crackers in it and used catsup and bbq sauce. It was super delish!

I‚Äôm late to the game here but I have a roommate who swore that she hated meatloaf. She said this for years and would gag if the word was brought up. I made this recipe a year and a half ago, and ever since she has been OBSESSED with this recipe. She begs for it almost weekly and raves about it to her friends. When her friends come over on meatloaf night, they say it‚Äôs the best they ever had. I‚Äôve now made this recipe as written so much that now I am the one who gags at the name. This recipe is a winner, hands down.
Great

Best meatloaf ever!!

I added extra onion because I love it and a bit extra ketchup and brown sugar, just for personal preference. 

This will be in my recipe book forever! ??
A huge hit. I would recommend cooking at 375 for 45-60 minutes
Made exactly as the recipe called for. It was basically bathed in the catsup brown sugar sauce. Excellent!!
I never had meatloaf like this but it's a great. My husband lived it. I served it with maple bacon baked beans and it was perfect!

This recipe was okay, I didn't understand putting the ketchup and brown sugar at the bottom of the loaf pan. I ended up pouring the sauce on top after it was done. The flavor was good and my daughter ate it, so it was a win.
Very good! I followed the recipe exactly and both my picky eater boyfriend and I loved it!
One of my favorite recipes of all time. I have turned friends into meatloaf lovers because of this bad boy. Nearly untouchable on its throne of deliciousness

Loved this! I did use breadcrumbs in place of saltines, coconut milk (no meat / dairy for kosher reasons), 2 large and 1 small clove of garlic (too much--will cut back to 2 next time), and I added 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce to the glaze, which I also put one top of the meat instead of the bottom. Amazing!
Followed the recipe like the others with the exception of 1/2 cu milk and I add the sauce on top and used a baking dish.

I followed the recipe to the tee, it was a little too sweet for my taste, also why not just use bbq sauce and I also used seasoned bread crumbs. Mom loved it though but I prefer a more savory meatloaf

I really enjoyed this recipe. Very good and the kids loved it. I was making it the other day and didn't have ground chuck, so I replaced it with ground turkey. Next I noticed I didn't have saltine crackers, so I replaced it with quake oats. This was just as good if not better.
